recipe_name: Roast sirloin served with a fricassée of girolle mushrooms in a red wine sauce
author: John Burton Race
programme: Chefs: Put Your Menu Where Your Mouth Is
method: Preheat the oven to 220/425F/Gas 7. For the red wine sauce, place the beef bones into a roasting tray and roast in the oven for 45 minutes or until browned all over.  Remove from the oven and place in a large pan with the chopped onion, carrot and celery.  Pour in the red wine and chicken stock, bring to a very low simmer for two hours. Strain the sauce and place back in a pan. Simmer until the sauce is a syrupy consistency. Season with salt and pepper, and whisk in the butter to add shine. Preheat the oven to 180C/350F/Gas 4.   For the roast beef, place the beef in a deep baking tray, drizzle with olive oil then season well with salt and pepper. Place in the oven and roast for 35-40 minutes then remove from the oven and place on a rack and allow to rest. For the mushrooms, heat the butter and oil in a large frying pan until foaming, then add the mushrooms, frying until lightly browned. Season with salt and pepper and stir through the parsley.  For the potatoes, add the potatoes to a pan of boiling water and simmer for five minutes until par-boiled. Drain. Place the drained potatoes into a large pan with the cream and garlic.  Simmer gently until the potatoes are tender, then season with salt and white pepper.  For  the beans, heat a little butter in a frying pan.  Add the shallot and cook for a minute then add the beans.  Fry for 1-2 minutes until warmed through, then season with salt and pepper.  To serve, carve the beef into thin slices and serve with the mushrooms, potatoes and green beans.  Finally drizzle with a little of the red wine sauce.
ingredients: 1kg/2lb 4oz beef bones,  1 carrot, roughly chopped,  2 sticks celery, roughly chopped,  1 onion, roughly chopped,  1 x 750ml bottle red wine,  1 litre/1¾ pint chicken stock,  salt and freshly ground black pepper,  1 tbsp butter,  800g/1lb 12oz sirloin, in a piece,  olive oil ,  200g/7oz wild mushrooms ,  1 tbsp olive oil,  40g/1½oz butter ,  2 tbsp chopped parsley,  8 medium waxy potatoes, peeled and turned,  1.2 litres/2 pints double cream (enough to cover),  6 garlic cloves, peeled,  25g/1oz butter,  1 shallot, finely chopped,  200g/7oz green beans, trimmed, blanched and refreshed
